page.title: 02Population Changes, Tockwith
page.content:
Population Census. 1951 1961 1971 1981 Tockwith 547 493 570 1130 Bickerton + Bilton 372 346 315 392
Tockwith is the largest village in our block and always has been. All three villages have followed a similar pattern over the years. In the 50's and 60's the population decreased as people moved into towns to live near their work. In the 70's and 80's the villages increased in size, particularly Tockwith, when new houses were built. Most people chose this area to live in because they wanted to live in a quiet, rural environment. They are prepared to travel long distances daily to work, usually by car.
